title: MORE ITEM SLOTS PLEASE 7 ITEM SLOT
body:
PLEASE RIOT 7 OR MORE ITEMS SLOT 
I BELIEVE THIS WILL ALLOW FOR A LOT OF GOOD CHANGES

replies.body: How, this will just allow the late game hyper carries to wreck face even harder
I know! all this does is give a reason for a game to drag on way longer then it really needs to. I can't see the reasoning behind this. He/She didn't even talk about what the "good changes" are.

Hmmm not necessarily. In a way it would speed up some games since if a team is snowballing they would be able to get 7 items faster. If your far behind your basically trying to stall until you catch up in items. With this your not worrying about catching up to that 6 item kha'zix, lee sin, yasuo, zed your worrying about a 7 ITEM kha'zix, lee sin, yasuo, zed. But then you've got champs like Kayle, Vayne and Veigar who would absolutely love a 7th item because then they're even more terrifying late game.

In the end I just don't see what it adds. I'm betting this guy just has a champ where he wants an extra item for their build
Support life, I always want more items than I can have :( I agree that 7 would be more problematic than it's worth tho.

That was one of the things I was going to mention but didn't for length :P

Who knows how adding another item slot would interact with all the actives in the game. Does it make the actives worth more as now you can have more, or less since you can now stack extra AD/AP/Defense? 

It would be a major shake up that I don't think you could accurately predict the effect of.

Edit: Also I feel that, I always want more items on tanks.

You'd probs have to pretty much nerf every item in the game, at which point it just serves to make games longer since it takes longer to get going, doesn't really help anything. I don't really enjoy 20 minute stomps but I also don't want all my games going for an hour.
Yeah agreed I'm just not sure what the upside would be. All it essentially does is throw the current balancing out the window.

I see your point, But I just feel that it isn't necessary for league. this idea seems more specific for a group of champions or just one in particular. Most of the games I play we finish before or right when everyone is full build.
*Technically* there already are 7 items slots. You have 6 that are open to most normal items (excluding champion specific items, where applicable), plus you have a trinket slot.
